titleStmt.title: To the Right Honourable the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, the humble petition of the Lord Major, aldermen, and commons of the City of London in Common-Councell assembled. As it was presented by the sheriffes, Common-Councell, and other citizens of the City of London, May the 9th. 1648. With the Parliaments answer thereunto, and votes upon the same. Likewise the petition of the grand jury at the assizes holden at Chelmsford for the county of Essex. And the answer thereunto. Imprimatur Gilbert Mabbot. May 9. 1648.
titleStmt.author: City of London (England). Court of Common Council.
England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: On the London militia and the garrisoning of the Tower.
The Parliament's replies to the Common Council are dated 9 May 1648, those to the grand jury 4 May 1648.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "more on [illegible] former".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
